abstracts.cdata!:
The Labor Force Training Support Project
            will finance a time-slice of an on-going Vocational
            Development Training Fund (FDFP) program, which will
            subsequently expand to include new client groups in the
            informal sector, where the largest portion of the target
            group is employed and growth is fastest. Its total cost of
            US$19.5 million will include three major components: (a)
            training, retraining and apprenticeship; (b) training
            outreach support; and (c) labor market monitoring and analysis.
